text.p: Investment company Incentive is expected to post a 1996 profit after financial items and including associate interests of 5.35 billion crowns, a Reuter poll of 10 analysts found on Thursday.
For 1995 Incentive reported a profit of 4.65 billion crowns.
Forecasts included one-off items of 2.57 billion crowns which is largely from the company's sale of its stake in Skandinaviska Elverk.
Forecasts for 1996 varied between 5.22 billion and 5.50 billion crowns.
For 1997 Incentive's profit was expected to fall to 3.50 billion crowns.
Analysts interviewed for the poll were from Aros, Carnegie, Enskilda, Fiba Nordic, Fischer Partners, Handelsbanken, James Capel, Nordbanken, Penser, and Swedbank.
Incentive is due to release is 1996 profits on Friday, March 7.
